content.prompt: In the xy-plane, which of the following is the graph of the implicitly defined function 16x2+4y2=64 ?

choices.label:
The x axis ranges from negative 20 to 20 in increments of 4. The y axis ranges from negative 36 to 36 in increments of 4. All coordinates are approximate.

  • The hyperbola is centered at the origin and opens up and down.
  • The vertices are at (0 comma 4) and (0 comma negative 4).
  • The asymptotes are y = negative 2 x and y = 2 x.

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option A. Refer to its long description

choices.label:
The x axis ranges from negative 40 to 40 in increments of 4. The y axis ranges from negative 32 to 32 in increments of 4. All coordinates are approximate.

  • The hyperbola is centered at the origin and opens left and right.
  • The vertices are at (negative 4 comma 0) and (4 comma 0).
  • The asymptotes are y = negative one half x and y = one half x.

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option B. Refer to its long description

choices.label:
Both axes range from negative 4 to 4 in increments of 1.

  • The ellipse intersects its horizontal line of symmetry at (negative 4 comma 0) and (4 comma 0).
  • The ellipse intercepts its vertical line of symmetry at (0 comma negative 2) and (0 comma 2).

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option C. Refer to its long description

choices.label:
Both axes range from negative 4 to 4 in increments of 1.

  • The ellipse intersects its horizontal line of symmetry at (negative 2 comma 0) and (2 comma 0).
  • The ellipse intersects its vertical line of symmetry at (0 comma negative 4) and (0 comma 4).

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option D. Refer to its long description

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
